name: Heritage Dining Table
shortDescription: Solid oak dining table, seats 6-8. Built to be passed down.
description: This is the table your family gathers around. Built from select white oak with hand-cut mortise and tenon joinery, the Heritage Dining Table is designed to anchor your home for generations. The natural grain tells its own story — no two tables are alike. Finished with a hand-rubbed oil that deepens the wood's character over time.

name: Craftsman Coffee Table
shortDescription: Walnut coffee table with clean lines and a soul.
description: Low-profile and built to last, the Craftsman Coffee Table brings warmth to any living space. Black walnut with visible sapwood contrast gives each piece its own personality. Dovetailed drawer for keeping things tidy. The kind of table that gets better with every coffee ring and book stack.

name: Workshop End Table
shortDescription: Cherry end table. Simple, sturdy, beautiful.
description: Sometimes the simplest designs are the hardest to get right. The Workshop End Table is cherry wood at its finest — clean tapered legs, a small shelf below, and a finish that lets the grain do the talking. Perfect next to your favorite chair.

name: Heirloom Bookshelf
shortDescription: Tall oak bookshelf built for a lifetime of stories.
description: Six shelves of solid white oak, joined with wedged through-tenons that are as beautiful as they are strong. The Heirloom Bookshelf is built to hold your library, your memories, and whatever else matters. Adjustable shelf heights. Stands on its own or mounts to the wall.

name: Floating Wall Shelf Set
shortDescription: Set of 3 maple floating shelves. Clean and minimal.
description: Three shelves, three lengths, zero visible hardware. These maple floating shelves install flush against the wall for a clean, modern look. Hidden steel brackets bear serious weight. Perfect for displaying the things you care about.

name: Artisan Cutting Board
shortDescription: Mixed hardwood cutting board. A kitchen essential.
description: Strips of walnut, maple, and cherry laminated edge-grain for a board that's as tough as it is good-looking. Juice groove around the edge, rubber feet on the bottom. The kind of cutting board that makes cooking feel like craft.

name: End Grain Butcher Block
shortDescription: Premium end-grain block. Gentle on knives, tough as nails.
description: End-grain construction means knife edges sink between the wood fibers instead of across them — your blades stay sharp longer. This butcher block is built from alternating walnut and maple end-grain squares. Heavy, stable, and built for serious kitchen work.

name: Hand-Carved Bowl
shortDescription: Cherry bowl carved by hand. Every one is unique.
description: Each bowl starts as a single block of cherry and is shaped entirely by hand with gouges and scrapers. No two are alike. The natural grain patterns and subtle tool marks give each piece its own character. Perfect for fruit, keys, or just sitting on a shelf looking beautiful.

name: Wooden Serving Tray
shortDescription: Walnut serving tray with leather handles.
description: A simple walnut tray with hand-stitched leather handles. Bring it to the table for dinner, use it on the ottoman for drinks, or hang it on the wall when you're not using it. The kind of piece that makes everyday moments feel a little more intentional.

name: Live Edge Console Table
shortDescription: Sycamore slab console with steel hairpin legs.
description: A single slab of American sycamore with its natural live edge intact, mounted on matte black steel hairpin legs. The bark edge is cleaned and sealed, preserving the raw character of the tree. Every slab is different — we'll send photos of available slabs before building yours.
finish: Epoxy sealed edges, satin poly top

name: Rustic Coat Rack
shortDescription: Reclaimed oak coat rack with hand-forged hooks.
description: Built from reclaimed barn oak with hand-forged iron hooks by a local blacksmith. The wood carries the marks of its past life — nail holes, weathering, and patina that you can't fake. Mounts to the wall with hidden hardware. Six hooks, plenty of character.

name: Custom Commission
shortDescription: Have something specific in mind? Let's build it together.
description: Every great piece starts with a conversation. Tell me what you need — a dining table for your growing family, a desk for your home office, a gift for someone who matters. We'll talk about wood, dimensions, finish, and budget. I'll build it by hand, right here in my workshop. Starting at $500.
